intro: Synotis rhabdos, commonly known as the narrow-leaf synotis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a distinctive central column. Synotis rhabdos is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
